Reason: The 'threads' configuration option in the sunflow software project is performance-sensitive because changing the number of threads can significantly impact system performance. Increasing the number of threads can lead to better parallelism and faster execution times, but it can also increase memory consumption and potentially cause contention issues. On the other hand, decreasing the number of threads may lead to slower execution times due to limited parallelism. Therefore, the 'threads' configuration option has a notable effect on system performance and is considered performance-sensitive.
